newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Five million N.Koreans hit by famine - aid group.
newsitem.headline: Five million N.Koreans hit by famine - aid group.

text.p: At least five million people in North Korea are badly hit by famine and many could die if they do not receive immediate foreign help, an aid group said on Tuesday.
"It is a disaster in the making," Ted Yamamori, president of the Food for the Hungry International, told Reuters in Seoul after visiting the hunger-stricken North last week.
"The consensus of aid workers operating in North Korea is that at least five million people are badly affected by famine," Yamamori said.

Yamamori, who visited North Korea from July 22-26 to monitor the distribution of 120 tonnes of wheat flour donated by his group, quoted Northern officials as saying about one-fifth of the country's arable land was seriously affected by drought.

"The people of North Korea appear to be suffering from hunger on the level of the notorious Somalia and Ethiopia famines," he said. "Only in North Korea, they are suffering in silence out of the view of the world's media."
North Korea said on Friday that a heat wave and a subsequent drought were having a "catastrophic" impact on its economy and worsening food shortages there.
